data_descriptor.name: staying_time_around_beacon
data_descriptor.description: Office staying time (total time between first entering time around the office beacon and last departure time from office beacon) according to Beacon model

data_descriptor.name: verdict
data_descriptor.description: Analysis of the staying time which is one of the three verdict: 1. less_than_expected_conservative_time 2. more_than_expected_conservative_time 3. in_expected_conservative_time. Expected conservative time is the half_hourly time of average staying time. For example if average staying time is 8 hour 20 minute then expected conservative time is 8 hour 30 minute on the other hand if average staying time is 8 hour 37 minute then expected conservative time is 9 hour. The staying time which are less than expected conservative time are labeled less_than_expected_conservative_time and the staying time which are more than expected conservative time are labeled as more_than_expected_conservative_time, the staying time which are exactly same as the expected conservative time are labeled as in_expected_conservative_time.

data_descriptor.name: deviation
data_descriptor.description: How much deviated from the expected conservative time (in minutes).

algorithm.description: Expected conservative staying time in office with verdict of more than or less than expected conservative staying time. Sample is a list with three elements as follows: 0 - Total staying time in minutes, 1 - verdict (more_than_expected_conservative_time, less_than_expected_conservative_time, in_expected_conservative_time), 2 - deviation from the expected conservative staying time in minutes. All staying times are taken according to beacon
